entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 143,393Chapters: 24/?Kudos: 16

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 159,737Chapters: 24/?Kudos: 44

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 131,863Chapters: 22/?Kudos: 17

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: Repression is my Heaven but I’d Rather Go Through Hell
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,793Chapters: 16/28Kudos: 105

Summary: For a heartbeat, neither of them moved. The morning sun glinted off her hair, the hum of a passing car filling the silence. Shannon shifted first, swallowing hard, her shoulders rising with a shaky breath. “Hi,” she said, her voice soft, tentative. “I’m… I’m Shannon. Eddie’s…” She faltered, her eyes flicking down, then back up to meet his. “Christopher’s mom.” Or, War didn’t break them. Distance didn’t. Shannon just might.

entry.summary:
Author: Tubagirl

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,997Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 18

Summary: Evan Buckley loves Eddie Diaz. Eddie Diaz loves Evan Buckley. They just haven’t told each other. entry.title: Practice Makes Perfect
entry.summary:
Author: Iceprincess96

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,786Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 16

Summary: When Buck convinces Eddie to join him for a night of speed dating, neither of them expect to walk away with anything except awkward stories and maybe some free appetizers. Instead, they spend the entire evening boring every single person in the room by talking about each other. When they finally wind up across the table together, it feels like a relief—but also a little bit of a wake-up call. Clearly, they’re doing something wrong in the dating department. So they make a deal: a couple of “practice dates,” just to figure out why they can’t seem to connect with anyone else. Only, the more they lean into fake flirting, hand-holding, and quiet dinners filled with laughter, the more obvious it becomes—dating isn’t the problem. The problem is that it’s not each other.

entry.title: The Boy Next Door
entry.summary:
Author: buddiesongfic

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,249Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 7

Summary: Buck smiles, almost too warm. “God, you're handsome, you know that?” Eddie chuckled, even though a flicker of discomfort ran through him. “Handsome, loyal, great, sexy…” Buck’s voice trailed, soft but deliberate. Eddie stood up, reaching for his jacket, letting out a huffing laugh at the last word. But when he turned around… Buck was already close. “So sexy…” Buck hushed, his face just inches from Eddie’s. The words were soft, intimate, but the gaze—locked, lingering—made Eddie freeze. OR; the literal (Maybe not) story of the movie The Boy Next Door

Eddie freaking bluescreens at the attractive guy in front of him. “Uhhh- Y-you know my name?” Eddie asks back like an idiot because he is acting like one right now. entry.title: Just Ask Josh
entry.summary:
Author: Madforyou

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 42,373Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 716

Summary: Chim is reading aloud before Buck can lunge across the counter and stop him, “I’d beg so loud they’d all know exactly what you—” His eyebrows climb to his hairline, “Buck, what the fuck?” Ravi bursts out laughing, nearly doubling over, “Wait, you sexted the group chat?!” “No, no, no—” Buck’s voice traitorously cracks and he can feel the heat in his face, “That’s not—I didn’t—” Hen’s tone sharpens, amusement undercut with curiosity, “You’re seeing someone? Who is she?” Or,Three months of secret hookups with Eddie and Buck manages to blow it all with one wrong text.

entry.title: hearts on fire
entry.summary:
Author: kryptonian

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,699Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 129

Summary: By the time they pull up to the venue, Buck is regretting everything. Eddie looks unfairly good. A dark button-down clings just right, tucked into dark wash jeans that make his boots look sharper than usual. His hair is pushed back, neat but still soft, and Buck catches the faint trace of his date cologne—the good stuff, the one Buck could pick out from across a room. It shouldn’t matter that Eddie looks good. Buck doesn’t even know why he cares. Ravi looks nice, too. Buck looks nice. His button-down is open over a dark undershirt, sleeves rolled up to bare his forearms—casual, effortless. Eddie even told Buck he looked good when he’d gotten in the car. The place is nice—strings of fairy lights across the patio, a banner that says Hearts on fire! Meet your soulmate! with little burning hearts decorating the corners. Ravi is texting in the backseat, muttering to himself as he shoots off a message to his friend that's hosting the event, while Buck just grips the steering wheel a little too tight—his knuckles pale with the tension of his clenched fists. OR, Ravi takes Buddie to a speed dating event. They find love.

Author: email_eddie

Summary: "And so I try to flirt with him, because honestly, the jealousy thing really does it for me—” Ravi gives her a look and she shakes her head, annoyed. “But when he looks at me, the scowl is still there. He’s full-on mean-mugging me. Like, what is his problem? He’s like ‘what did Eddie say?’ and I’m confused because I guess they know each other? And then he just ignores me for the rest of the five minutes. Choosing instead to stare at Eddie like he had telekinesis or whatever. It was just insane. entry.title: Happier Than Ever
entry.summary:
Author: stonyismyotp

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,984Chapters: 10/?Kudos: 208

Summary: "It’s Dr. Wells. The Dr. Wells Bobby had sent Buck to, over a year and a half ago. The same one he couldn’t quite admit had taken advantage of him, had made him feel numb whenever he tried sharing his feelings, who made it impossible to open up to any other therapist— She was there and she had a baby. A baby who couldn’t be more than ten months old. A baby with his blonde hair and bright blue eyes, not her dark hair and dark eyes." or Dr. Wells had a baby & never told Buck. - title from the song by billie eilish pls heed the tags, & i'll be putting warnings at the beginning of each chapter, this is going to be a relatively heavy fic (tho it will be focused on recovery) so pls prioritize your own mental health.

entry.title: Pause / Unpause
entry.summary:
Author: harlem_osborne

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,214Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 12

Summary: The Pause/ Unpause Rules of engagement.Should two partners ever get into an argument, The Pause/Unpause engagement, simply imply that they can fight, only when stated. Usually a disagreement , an argument, a difference of opinon; can, be used to press Pause, should the moment become too heavy, or too deep to continue without hurting the other person, or themselves further, during said argument/fight/disagreement. Saying "Unpause" causes the partners to continue where they left off with a different point of view, after taking a moment of silence, to create an entirely new outlook on the situation, hoping the two can come to a conflict resolve.

entry.title: The Family We Chose
entry.summary:
Author: buddiecanon118

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 69,186Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 267

Summary: “Hi, I’m Eddie Diaz, Jee-Yun’s Uncle.” “Mr. Diaz, lovely to put a face to the name.” She shakes his hand quickly. “ She talks about you and your husband all the time, and so does Buck whenever he helps out.” And Eddie should correct her. He really should. He and Buck are decidedly not married, they’re not even dating. Sure, Eddie’s though about it, of course he has. They’ve been best friends for years, his son loves him, and they’ve been sleeping in the same bed since he and Christopher got back from El Paso. But Eddie’s straight, and Buck isn’t into him like that. He’s going to correct her. Definitely. He’s going to look at her and say– “Yep, that’s me.” Oh. That’s not… Or: Eddie chaperones Jee-Yun's school field trip, Buck gets jealous, and things spiral from there
